Description: THE PROJECT WILL BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY STAKEHOLDERS AT THE NATIONAL AND DISTRICT LEVEL TO PROSECUTE TIP CASES AND PROTECT VICTIMS.
TO OFFER PROTECTIVE SERVICES TO VICTIMS OF TRAFFICKING IN MOROCCO AND HELP MOROCCO PROSECUTE TRAFFICKERS.
TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH GOVERNMENTAL, NON-GOVERNMENTAL, AND GRASSROOTS STAKEHOLDERS TO ENSURE THE PROTECTION OF UKRAINIAN REFUGEES AND OTHER VULNERABLE POPULATIONS FROM HUMAN TRAFFICKING.

ENABLE FRONTLINE MULTIDISCIPLINARY THAI, MYANMAR, AND LAOTIAN AGENCIES ON THE THAI, MYANMAR, AND LAOTIAN BORDER TO IDENTIFY AND PROVIDE PROTECTION TO MIGRANT WORKERS WHO ARE VICTIMS OF, OR AT RISK OF, HUMAN TRAFFICKING.
TO SUPPORT LOCAL CASE MANAGEMENT AND INVESTIGATION ACTORS IMPROVE THEIR OPERATIONS THROUGH IMPORT OF PROMISING PRACTICES

THIS PROJECT WILL BOLSTER THE RESPONSE TO COMBATING HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN SOUTH AFRICA BY WORKING ALONGSIDE THE GOVERNMENT FROM WITHIN THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM IN A LONG-TERM PARTNERSHIP, PROVIDING DAY-TO-DAY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO TIP SURVIVORS IN KURDISTAN REGION OF IRAQ (KRI) WHILE ALSO HELPING KRI GOVERNMENT IDENTIFY VICTIMS AND PROSECUTE TRAFFICKERS

TO ENHANCE MEXICOS NATIONAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LEVEL RESPONSE TO HUMAN TRAFFICKING, PARTICULARLY FOR MIGRANTS, DISPLACED POPULATIONS, AND OTHER VULNERABLE GROUPS, INCLUDING CHILDREN.
TO MEASURABLY REDUCE CHILD FORCED BEGGING IN NIGER AND WEST AFRICA

INCREASE IDENTIFICATION OF OCSE VICTIMS BY SUPPORTING THE CREATION AND TRAINING OF 3 OCSE DEDICATED POLICE UNITS IN JAKARTA AND EAST JAVA AND BALI AND PROVIDE TRAINING MATERIALS IN BAHASA IN ICMECS ELEARNING ON DEMAND PLATFORM

HELP HIGHLIGHT TRAFFICKING IN THE GULF REGION AND PUSH CORPORATIONS AND GOVERNMENTS TO ADDRESS TIP
INCREASE THE INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TIP IN TANZANIA WHILE ALSO EXPANDING VICTIM SUPPORT
FOR UML TO CONDUCT FORMATIVE RESEARCH ON CHILD TRAFFICKING IN COTE D'IVOIRE.
OSEC PREVENTION AND PROTECTION IN LUZON AND VISAYAS IN THE COVID-19 CONTEXT.
ENDING HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN VIETNAM

THIS PROJECT WILL FINALIZE THE MULTI-STAKEHOLDER COLLABORATIVE EFFORT PREVIOUSLY SUPPORT BY J/TIP TO COMPLETE AND LAUNCH THE SHELTER, PUBLISH SHELTER GUIDELINES, AND WORK WITH THE GOVERNMENT TO CREATE A PLAN FOR SHELTER MANAGEMENT MOVING FORWARD.
MIGRANT DOMESTIC WORKERS IN LEBANON ARE PROTECTED FROM HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND OTHER FORMS OF EXPLOITATION AND ABUSE.

WORKING IN LILONGWE, MWANZA, AND MULANJE - PLAN INT. WILL STRENGTHEN CAPACITY OF FRONT-LINE ACTORS, REFINE AND ALIGN NATIONAL LEVEL POLICIES AND PROGRAMMING, BOLSTER SUPPORT TO VOTS, AND LINK COMMUNITY, DISTRICT AND NATIONAL LEVEL INITIATIVES.
THE PROJECT SEEKS TO REDUCE THE RISK OF TRAFFICKING AND REVICTIMIZATION BY ENSURING ACCESS TO TIP SPECIALIZED SHELTERS, COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES, AND COMPENSATION.

THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP TARGETED INTERVENTIONS TO REDUCE THE PREVALENCE OF EXPLOITATIVE CHILD DOMESTIC WORK; PILOT-TEST THE INTERVENTIONS; AND USE THE EVIDENCE TO ARTICULATE AN INTERVENTION MODEL FOR LOCAL AND REGIONAL STAKEHOLDERS TO REDUCE ABUSES AND
THE PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP A MULTI-COUNTRY STRATEGY TO IMPROVE CAPACITY TO IDENTIFY VICTIMS OF TIP AND ENHANCED PROTOCOLS, PROCESSES, AND STRATEGIES TO PROTECT MIGRANTS AND LIKELY MIGRANTS

TO STRENGTHEN THE JUSTICE SECTORS RESPONSE TO PREVENT PROTECT AND PROSECUTE TIP CASES IN CARTAGENA BY IMPROVING VICTIM IDENTIFICATION POLICIES AND PROCEDURES REFERRAL PATHWAYS AND SERVICES AND INVESTIGATION AND PROSECUTION OF TIP CASES

ASSISTING THE THAI GOVERNMENT TO CREATE CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS ON INVESTIGATING LABOR TRAFFICKING CASES.
USING AN ONLINE TRAINING PLATFORM TO FIGHT AGAINST ONLINE CHILD SEXUAL EXPLOITATION WORLDWIDE.
STRENGTHENED NATIONAL AND LOCAL/COMMUNITY LEVEL CAPACITIES AND SCALED UP COMMUNITY DRIVEN RESPONSES EFFECTIVELY COMBAT AND RESPOND TO TIP.

ESTABLISH THE VICTIM-CENTERED APPROACH TO CTIP EFFORTS IN UZBEKISTAN, BY MEANS OF CONTRIBUTING TO POLICY IMPROVEMENT, INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY BUILDING TO DELIVER SURVIVOR-CENTERED SERVICES, SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND FOSTERING SOCIAL PARTNERSHIP.

INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TIP CASES IDENTIFIED, REFERRED,  INVESTIGATED AND PROSECUTED - THROUGH CAPACITY BUILDING AND AN OPERATIONAL NRM AT THE NATIONAL AND REGIONAL LEVEL.
THE PROJECT WILL AIM TO PROMOTE COHERENT AND EVIDENCE-BASED ANTI-HUMAN TRAFFICKING STANDARDS AND POLICIES ACROSS UN ORGANS AND TREATY BODIES.

IPA AIMS TO SUPPORT THE NIGERIAN GOVERNMENT TO REDUCE HUMAN TRAFFICKING BY ESTABLISHING AN EMBEDDED EVIDENCE LAB THAT WILL EQUIP THE GOVERNMENT TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER MORE EFFECTIVE, EVIDENCE-BASED POLICIES AND PROGRAMS TO COMBAT SEX TRAFFICKING.

NORC WILL CONDUCT A PREVALENCE STUDY THAT PROVIDES RIGOROUS, EMPIRICAL DATA, ALONG WITH FORMATIVE QUALITATIVE RESEARCH, THAT WILL INFORM CPC PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM AREAS AND PROMOTE HIGH-IMPACT INTERVENTION ACTIVITIES.

REDUCE TIP IN BANGLADESH BY ASSISTING FARMERS AND FISHERS VULNERABLE TO TIP IN AREAS IMPACTED BY CLIMATE CHANGE, INTEGRATING TIP INTO NATIONAL AND LOCAL CLIMATE PLANS, AND CONDUCTING RESEARCH TO CONTRIBUTE EVIDENCE ON TIP AND CLIMATE CHANGE.

WORKING WITH TIP SURVIVORS, IOM WILL EMPLOY A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY-BASED MODEL TO CREATE RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE CHANGE THROUGH LIVELIHOOD SUPPORT, SOCIO-ECONOMIC SERVICES, BEHAVIOR CHANGE, AND A PREVALENCE MODEL ON CLIMATE CHANGE AND TIP.

TO DEVELOP METHODOLOGIES AND STANDARD STATISTICAL INDICATORS TO MEASURE TRAFFICKING IN PERSONS, FORCED LABOUR AND TRAFFICKING FOR FORCED LABOUR THROUGH THE GLOBAL CONSULTATION, ENGAGEMENT, AND CONSENSUS OF MEMBER STATES.

TO EQUIP SURVIVORS OF TRAFFICKING WISHING TO PURSUE ENTREPRENEURSHIP WITH THE FOUNDATION TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS.

TO ENHANCE THE AWARENESS OF CHILD TRAFFICKING, SPECIFICALLY THE FORCED RECRUITMENT OF CHILD. AND TO TO STRENGTHEN PROTECTION SERVICES FOR CHILDREN WHO WERE FORMALLY RECRUITED OR AT RISK OF BEING RECRUITED
